summary: This document is an email chain from August 16, 2019, regarding camera system outages at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It reports that 23 out of 161 cameras were not recording, and mentions ongoing work to fix the system, including testing on generator power.

persons.name: Jeff
persons.context: Mentioned as a technician from Signet who will be working on finishing and testing the camera system on generator power at MCC New York.

events.title: Camera Outage Report at MCC New York
events.description: A report indicates that 23 out of 161 cameras were not recording at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

events.title: Camera System Status Update
events.description: An Electronic Technician reported that MCC NY has 161 cameras, with 141-146 recording on the new system, and 15-20 needing work. Approximately 110 cameras were labeled correctly at the recorder.

locations: MCC New York, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
MCC-New York, 150 Park Row, New York NY 10007-1704
keyFacts: On August 16, 2019, 23 out of 161 cameras were reported as not recording at MCC New York, representing a 14.3% outage rate.
The camera system was undergoing work, with 15-20 cameras needing to be made operational, and only about 110 cameras were correctly labeled at the recorder.
A technician named Jeff from Signet was scheduled to work on finishing and testing the system on generator power.
The email chain indicates a protocol for daily updates on camera outages to be forwarded to the Associate Warden and Warden.
The correspondence highlights potential security monitoring issues at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
